page.title: 18Bourtie community spririt
page.content: People in Bourtie have long been adapted to the hardships of isolation and weather and its is common for neighbours to extend a helping hand in times of difficulty. New members of the community are welcomed warmly, especially if they show an interest in the Kirk (church) at Kirton of Bourtie, around which many activities centre. For example, when the new minister in 1982 thought the church could do with sprucing up, the community rallied and held a barndance and barbecue on one of the farms and all proceeds went twards the decoratin of the Kirk interior. When roads are closed by snowdrifts or one person's well waer becomes contaminated, as happened in a sudden snow thaw in 1985, neighbours quickly offer to shuttle in food on the tractor or provide clean water.
